item.name: 10' to Kill
item.comment: The couple of games of this I played were just average. Instead of maintaining its pace the police add a huge 'Rush' atmosphere. I recognize they are there as a timing mechanism but it seemed too forced.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: This is a good game for a larger group of people. Plays quickly and is easy to understand.

item.name: Abalone
item.comment: Abstract Strategy game in which balls are pushed around the board while you are trying to push off the other players color. Newer versions come with a football varient in which both players are trying to push off a single green ball. Takes a minute to learn but not quite a lifetime to master. An alright strategy game. The kids seem to enjoy this more than I do, the rules are simple enough for them to understand and if you are not playing completely cut-throat they will enjoy themselves.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment: A very fun and managable rail game. Find a balance between spending money for railroads and managing your income, while having to pay expenses for the progress and developments made.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Light-Medium Strategy game with no direct player interaction. Some luck is involved in which tiles get drawn out of the bag for bidding. Biggest decision is when to pay the exact amount for a tile for another turn, and where to place the tile once purchased.

item.name: The aMAZEing Labyrinth
item.comment: Excellent simple game for the whole family. No reading required, items are based on pattern recognition which means little kids can play while getting a little help with the path generation portion. They love sliding the pieces to form a new dungeon layout.

item.name: Anomia
item.comment: Light party game. Enjoyed the game I played.

item.name: Aqua Romana
item.comment: A little chaotic but fun.

item.name: Aquadukt
item.comment: A fun tile-laying game with a slight "take-that" flavor to it. Nice and light for the family.

item.name: Aquaretto
item.comment: Great family game. Adds some nice changes to Zooloretto. The additional bonus with the zoo workers can help change the goals of individual players in which animals they try to grab.

item.name: Arena Maximus
item.comment: Only played once so far. Seemed ok. The order of the players turns can sometimes be confusing I found.

item.name: The Ark of the Covenant
item.comment: Good stand-alone Carcassonne game. "Farming" meeples cancel each other out in the scoring instead of sharing points creating more tension in laying those types of meeples. I found the ark doesn't get much play in my games.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: I like it!

item.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer
item.comment: More tactical in the order you play the cards. Didn't seem like as much choice with what to purchase, just buy the most expensive you can afford / worth the most points usually works.

item.name: Atlanteon
item.comment: Short brain filler. Nothing too special here.

item.name: Atta Ants
item.comment: Didn't really do anything for me. Spider movement being formulaic didn't seem right or fit well.

item.name: Attika
item.comment: A fun game which I find works best with 3 people. Some luck involved with the drawing of city tiles. The draw or build phase of each turn seems to work well and keep it balanced.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment: A nice game similar to Lost Cities, with the option to play cards on your opponents side. Plus, the added strategy of trying to buy the balloon cards makes for a fun light game.

item.name: Batt'l Kha'os
item.comment: Fun light game of area control / majority on the corners of connecting tiles. Have to watch out for the tie breakers since the "owner" of the tower color wins.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: The system allows for nice combat resolution. I like the fantasy theme. I need to play this more.

item.name: Battlestations
item.comment: Currently after 1 play I am not very impressed. I expect this will go up after additional plays however. I think I tried to do the mission in the incorrect order which lead to there being no chance of success.

item.name: Berserker Halflings from the Dungeon of Dragons
Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment: Rating based on a 5 player game. I went in thinking this was a game where "secretly, one of the characters betrays the rest of the party". Unfortunately nothing was in secret (except for special abilities). I don't see any value with playing as a team when randomly someone is going to trigger the haunting second phase by exploring a room. A big meh.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: A good abstract game that kids can enjoy as well. Works well for 2 and 4 players. Not really good for 3.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
item.comment: Finally got to try it. A nice variation with not as much focus on deck-building than I originally thought there was. The asynchronous races and teams make for some great matchups.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Have only played the 2 player version. Would like to try with more players so theres more trading as a part of the turn and strategy.

item.name: Bonkers!
item.comment: Always a great family game. Roll and Move but some strategy involved with the placing of the tiles. You can usually pick it up really cheap in a second hand store and it's worth it.

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 1 – Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment: When playing we typically always use this expansion. Adds some strategy because it changes the way unfinished roads and cities are scored at the end of the game.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: An excellent stand-alone Carcassonne game. The bonus tiles which you pick up along the scoring track are a nice addition and are used to help generate additional points during the game or at the end scoring.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River
item.comment: Typically we always play with the River. Adds some extra choices for the beginning game.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: Only with the right group is this going to be enjoyable. Luckily I can usually identify the right group.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: Keep for the kids.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: I think the game has lived up to its Hype. Many decisions to be made each phase and each turn. No luck is invloved while the game is played out. A reprint is being done to fix some of the "problems" in which I don't see any of. The coins are kinda cheesy in the first edition but when has any true BGGer not replaced the counters in a game :)

item.name: Celestia
item.comment: A nice addition to the push your luck style game. Reminds me of Incan gold but with strategic reasons why you would exit the airship early instead of carry on.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: Meh. I thought I would like it but found the iconology made it very hard to tell what was happening. I usually find Fantasy Flight Games to be better structured but this one feel like icons are just thrown on the board. Map boundaries are difficult to see and I had to keep second guessing or checking to make sure "adjacent" areas were in fact that. The game itself was interesting. Perhaps after a few more plays I might be able to see some better strategy but I don't see that happening.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I find chess a boring abstract. Maybe if I practiced more..... I usually make my decisions on hoping the other player misses a good move which never works well.

item.name: Chez Dork
item.comment: An ok game that the wife and son like to play. 2 players game don't really have trading or auctions which makes some of the cards not applicable.

item.name: Chez Geek 2: Slack Attack
item.comment: See Chez Geek. I was upset however with the cards as they have a different border on them then the original and Chez Geek 3.

item.name: Chez Geek 3: Block Party
item.comment: See Chez Geek. The box that comes with this one is nice to keep all the cards in.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: Fun with lots of people.

item.name: Clans
item.comment: A fun abstract game in which you try to form villages with different colored peasants. Not knowing which color the other players have makes for an interesting game usually.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.wishlistcomment: Meh, it was alright but I don't think it would be good for the family. I may play with a group again.

item.name: Codenames
item.comment: This was a lot of fun. Played my first game in the Uk. Beware cultural differences and references! Lost the game because of differences in political structures.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: My comment before i played was "Political and too chaotic? Not sure if I would like." I was dead correct. The mass and total chaos of having your cards taken away from you before a negotiation and having someone else dictate if the "Loser" wins just made this impossible to do any kind of planning.

item.name: Coup
item.comment: This just didn't click for me. I don't enjoy the "Guess if I'm lying" type of games and this is certainly one of them.

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment: I'll play it, but I don't have to like it!

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: Needs 3 or more players.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment: Lots going on with the various powers and skills. The Overlord needs to play to win otherwise its not as much fun. Every time we play we figure out a new rule. Very fun, long experience. Need to make sure I have the time to play through a scenario.

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: Hidden role victory conditions make for a fun game.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: Now I see what the fuss is about. A great game which scratches the CCG itch without costly investment.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Once I played Descent by Fantasy Flight I can see how the rules in Doom were expanded upon and done better. The sci-fi theme is fun but I think I'll be playing Descent over this if I have the choice.

item.name: The Downfall of Pompeii
item.comment: Light family strategy game. The game split into two phases gives opportunity for a little take-that without getting put too far behind that you cannot still do well.

item.name: Dragon Rampage
item.comment: One of those "it's a co-op but there is still 1 winner" games with scoring that seemed a little strange. If you focus on just killing the dragon or running you seem to still be at the mercy of getting treasures and others.

item.name: Drake & Drake
item.comment: A fun pirate 2 player game.

item.name: Duel of Ages Set 1: Worldspanner
item.comment: A little chaotic. I need to play this with more than 2 people to have all of the elements fall into place. During the first game there was not much player conflict. Turned into more of a timed race, i.e. who could do the temples the first.

item.name: The Duke
item.comment: Really enjoying this 2 player abstract. The whole method of the pieces changing the way they move and can attack really adds a level of depth that's a lot of fun. We haven't yet explored the advanced rules with capturing and ransom but very soon.

item.name: Dungeon Run
item.comment: The dungeon explore part of the game seems to work but the second part falls apart for me with a little too much back-stabbing and direct conflict. A solid Meh.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Need to play some more to get a proper feeling about. So far I'm not really impressed.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Eldritch Horror
item.comment: Cthulhu Pandemic with character stats. Somewhat enjoyed the first game. Played with some people who could not choose a move if their life depended on it. That influenced my likeing a bit.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: Anything but the "Advanced Game" options seem like a waste of time.

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: Played but don't think the family would like. Would play again with a gaming group, just not to buy.

item.name: Escape: Zombie City
item.comment: I'm not really into real-time games. It's borderline on being too stressful for my liking. Played very solo for us, a little interaction during the escape on the bus for unlocking other players dice but other than that it's heads down and roll on your own.

item.name: Evo
item.comment: A very good game for Non-Board-Gamers. Basic warfare, strategy, and character (or dinosaur) development.

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: Played with the new flight expansion. Interesting game with variable powers for all your creatures. Changes to strategy are required based on what other players are evolving into.

item.name: Fealty
item.comment: Really enjoying this quick strategy game with the family. The 4 player game was a little tighter than the 2 player one. Play on the iPad and iPhone as well.

item.name: Fireball Island
item.comment: An ok game. +1 for nostalgia. My son loves this game.

item.name: Fjords
item.comment: A nice two player game played in two phases. Phase 1 is building the board with the tiles. Phase 2 is placing the scoring markers. Strategy involved in laying of the tiles and placing the scoring markers.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: Enjoyed my first solo game. Need ot get it to the table with the family.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: With the right group of people, particularly our family, this game works very well. If we want to play a light card game, this is usually what hits the table.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Light version of Pandemic. Great for the family or for kids.

item.name: The Game of Life: A Jedi's Path
item.comment: Somehow i thought the star wars theme would make this a better game. I was wrong.

item.name: Glen More
item.comment: Really liked the various elements of this game coming together at the end.

item.name: Gloom
item.comment: Fun card game.

item.name: Gloom: Unhappy Homes
item.comment: In the games I've played I haven't had the houses play that much in scoring, but they can make a difference.

item.name: Gourmet Challenge
item.comment: Trivial Pursuit style game but all about food, cooking, its preperation and history. A must for all would-be chefs or people who enjoy food.

item.name: The Great Brain Robbery
item.comment: Game starts out with a nice exploration theme for finding the brains. Once someone finds a brain they really like it becomes a race to the front of the train to stop them!

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: Light card game. Some cards seem a little over-powered. I would have liked to see more ones that affected other players then getting the ones which move the nobles forwards and backwards in the line.

item.name: Die Händler von Genua
item.comment: German Edition. Did play the English reprint and I'm not too keen on it. 3 person game went on a long time with a lot of just waiting to see if anyone wants to bid on an action. The whole super-openness to the trading seemed like a little more constraints would have helped it out. Not for me or my group but I can see why some people would love it for exactly the reasons I do not.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Jandar's Oath
item.comment: I have the Monks & Sentinels, Gorillas & Hounds, and Kilts & Agent Commandos

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Orm's Return
item.comment: I have the first half of this expansion "The Heroes of Laur".

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: Easy to learn with simple mechanics there is a surprising number of choices to make. Do you go for the most fish with one penguin while trying to cut off another's play's with the other? Try not to get caught on the edge or you may find yourself floating off to sea.

item.name: Hungry Hungry Hippos
item.comment: My son loves this game. I hate it. SOOOO loud.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: Lots of plays on the PC version. Quick game when the scoring is calculated automatically!

item.name: Innovation
item.comment: Enjoying this every time I play. A lot of time needs to be spent trying to formulate strategies I find, mostly in defense so other people can't take your well formulated cards.

item.name: The Isle of Doctor Necreaux
item.comment: The terminology in the rules is terrible to try to distinguish who is a "player", "character", etc. I'm still not sure if we have ever played this right.

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment: Really enjoy this quick 2 player game.

item.name: Jamaica
item.comment: Rated after 1 play, 4 players. Light pirate themed race game. Combined with dice rolls cards are used to determine movement and resource collection. Turn order can influence which cards you play based on shared spaces.

item.name: James Ernest's Totally Renamed Spy Game
item.comment: Totally Renamed Spy Game version.

item.name: Junta: Viva el Presidente!
item.comment: A nice streamlined version of the original Junta game. The battles take little time and there is still the meta gaming with El Presidente

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment: Fun 2 player game in which you try to capture islands by being the majority color connected to them. Many changes can happen with the ability to remove connectors thus sometimes changing the colors of many islands in a single action.

item.name: Keydom
item.comment: Auction games are not my thing however the "blind auction" phases of this game seemed to work well and I enjoyed it. Only played once.

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
item.comment: Original Cheap Ass Games version.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: Some of the cards make it very unbalanced. Trying to change the winning conditions to be less random than they are currently. The whole winning "lottery" is dumb. Never ask me to play this again please.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot RED Booster
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot VIOLET Booster
King of Tokyo
item.comment: Souped up Yahtzee with special action cards. It was alright but nothing seemed amazing about it. My son loves it so we got it for Christmas.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: I enjoyed this game. Multiple paths to victory obtaining victory points. The powers of the various buildings make for different strategic choices between games.

item.name: Kung Fu Fighting
item.comment: Fun card game which can work for 2 players but gets more interesting with more due to attacks that can be made to more then one person. The variety of weapons and stance cards which can be played is fun and can help enhance your attacks or your opponents, so be careful!

item.name: Kung Fu Samurai on Giant Robot Island
Labyrinth: The Card Game
item.comment: Kids are just too old for this now.

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment: Fun worker placement. 4players seemed to be the perfect amount.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment: A solid game in the "Secret Movement" category.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: 2012 Intro Packs "Mystical Might", "Entangling Webs", "Blood and Fire", "Sacred Assault", "Grab for Power". The Intro packs have allowed us to play without requiring to buy boosters with randoms in them.

item.name: Mag·Blast (Second Edition)
item.comment: Reminds me of Naval War(1979) theme in space! A short space battle game that is fun if it lasts for 15min. Anything more and it gets worn out. Has dropped over time to much better light card games in my collection.

item.name: Mag·Blast (Third Edition)
item.comment: Nice graphics. Gameplay pretty much remains the same from the 2nd edition version. This has downgraded over time. My son likes it but it's just not that fun.

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
Martian Fluxx
item.comment: Great addition to the Fluxx family. Additional "powers" in the Keeper cards allows for a little deeper strategy. Fluxx has certainly aged in this household. My son is old enough that we have moved onto more complex games.

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Marvel Heroes
item.comment: Still need to sort out the rules. It will probably go higher based on more plays.

item.name: Masons
item.comment: Fun light game.

item.name: Monsters Menace America
item.comment: Like Risk only they made the rules and abilities more dynamic and results in finiky dice-fest encounters.

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: Fluxx has certainly aged in this household. My son is old enough that we have moved onto more complex games.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: Fun little 2 player deduction game.

item.name: Munchkin Booty
item.comment: No surprises here. Munchkin themed with pirates. The theme doesn't do it for me and if I want to play Munchkin I'll play the original.

item.name: Munchkin Booty 2: Jump the Shark
item.comment: No surprises here. Munchkin themed with pirates. The theme doesn't do it for me and if I want to play Munchkin I'll play the original.

item.name: Munchkin Quest
item.comment: Gives more of a boardgame feel to dungeon exploring aspects vs the card game. Monsters may also move around from room to room. Adds some strategy elements because of the different room bonuses for race and class characters. My son enjoys it more than the card game at this point.

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment:
Really enjoying this game with 2 players as well as 3 and 4. Nice medium strategy game. The online Java version also works fairly well.
The different armies makes you play in different styles depending on who you are playing.
Also enjoy playing the IOS version on my iPod.

item.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game
item.comment: First play with only 2 people didn't go so well. The game isn't great for 2. Will re-evaluate after trying with more.

item.name: Nightfall
item.comment: As soon at it seems I can get a nice chain set the game seems to end. Not sure if I just don't have the flow of the cards yet.

item.name: Odin's Ravens
item.comment: Only played a few times but they have been very enjoyable and very close. First time I was tied at 11 points after 4 games with the fifth deciding who the winner was.

item.name: Owner's Choice
item.comment: A quick stock market game that can scratch that stock market itch within a filler time limit.

item.name: Penny Arcade: The Card Game
item.comment: More on the "I like to play" side of things than the very good game side. My son loves it and so its something that I will never turn down a game of. It could be so much worse....

item.name: Perry Rhodan: The Cosmic League
item.comment: Slightly disappointed in this 2-player game that I kept hearing great things about.

item.name: Piece o' Cake
item.comment: Light Filler.

item.name: Piña Pirata
item.comment: Played with 6 people and it took way too long for what this game is. Maybe with 4 this would be better.

item.name: Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: A fun game. Pirate ships are tough to measure distances because there so light. Seemed to move around a lot. Playing without any crew seemes like a lost cause as you will get killed rather quickly.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: Great family game.

item.name: Pocket Battles: Elves vs. Orcs
item.comment: Meh, I don't really enjoy the strategy for the combat ordering.

item.name: Politics as Usual
item.comment: Theme doesn't entice me. Game supports two players but has cards which can only be played with 3 or more involved. One play was enough for me to know I don't want to try another.

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.comment: Didn't get in a full game of this. Got to play enough to see the interesting choices that need to be made. Even with the auction mechanism it was still feeling very "solo". Will try some more.

item.name: Powerboats
item.comment: Light racing game which played well with my group.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Meh

item.name: Quantum
item.comment: Played a map that encouraged fighting but nothing to intense. This abstract strategy worked well with the 3 players for my first play and came down to a very close game.

item.name: The Red Dragon Inn 3
item.comment: Didn't feel like there were many interesting decisions. An absolute take-that type of game. It's hard not to gang up on individuals during play.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment: I'm not a huge fan of the "guess the traitor" games. This is no exception, but a light filler.

item.name: The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: I just really don't like the "resistance" style games.

item.name: Return of the Heroes
item.comment: I think I need to play this some more to get a good feel for it. The "random" encounters tile laying mechanic doesn't seem very random as I remembered where the tiles were that I put down. There is no player interaction, more race conditions to see who can finish the quest first.

item.name: Revolution!
item.comment: During my first play the game seemed to have a runaway leader issue but I think I was playing too much to the current turn instead of future turns. Not sure if there was enough that I will play again.

item.name: Rise!
item.comment: We have enough games like this already.

item.name: River Dragons
item.comment: Not bad, average game. Medium since you have to chose your moves ahead of time.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Rune Age
item.comment: Need to play more I think to adjust my rating. In the scenario we were playing there seems to be no purpose to some of the inner-player conflicts that could be happening.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: I own the 2nd Edition. Contains fixes that were causing players problems in the 1st edition (all starting from the bottom instead if the middle, using 1D20 instead of 2D10, etc.). A fun adventure game containing good RPG character development mechanisms.

item.name: Scary Tales: Snow White vs. The Giant
item.comment: This was a letdown for me. I knew it was primarily based on luck, which doesn't normally bother me, but I didn't realize the complete lack of choices you have while playing. Disappointing.

item.name: SET
item.comment: My brain starts hurting after a while.

item.name: Shadow Hunters
item.comment: Somewhat dice-fest for 5 or more people. Will play sporadically.

item.name: Small World
item.wishlistcomment: Just don't think it would go over well with the family. It was fun the first time I played.

item.name: Snakes and Ladders 3D
item.comment: The 3D board actually lets the plastic marble men slide to the correct spot however because of the 3D layout, the numbers are not equally spaced in all places causing young people to become confused when counting out their movement.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Spyfall
item.comment: I'm not too big on deduction games but this one was fun with the big group.

item.name: Star Wars: Escape From Death Star Game
item.comment: English version of the game

item.name: Star Wars: Escape From Death Star Game
item.comment: English / French version

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing
item.comment: Played for the first time and seems like it will be a hit. Already going to be disastrous for my wallet.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment: Rated after just 1 play. I don't see that I would be able to play often and this game seems to end even faster than Twilight Imperium. Just as I'm about to embark on a great journey across the stars the game ends. Not much time to put together any meaty strategy.

item.name: Starship Catan
item.comment: A fun 2 player game which brings some of the mechanics of settlers into the space theme. Track your resources on the players ship cargo holds themselves instead of with cards. Also the ability to upgrade the guns and boosters are a nice bonus as well the ability to "capture" a planet to be used for trading.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: Rated after 1 play w. 4 players. Medium strategy game. Placement of workers defines resources and abilities. A little bit of randomness lies in rolling for resources; your not always guaranteed to get some. Cards can be purchased for bonuses at the end of the game.

item.name: Summoner Wars
item.comment: What a great family game to play. Lots of variety and just the right amount of luck make this a great game.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Fallen Kingdom Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Goodwin's Blade Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Grungor's Charge Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Hawk's Strike Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Jungle Elves Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
item.comment: Some nice powers. The burn the leader can do can be especially handy.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Rukar's Power Reinforcements Pack
Survive!
item.comment: One of my personal blast from the past games. This was one of the games I always played at my cottage. Fun family game which doesn't require deep strategy to play. Has some luck elements as well for moving sea creatures around trying to topple over boats or eating swimmers.

item.name: This Game is Bonkers!
item.comment: Always a great family game. Roll and Move but some strategy involved with the placing of the tiles. You can usually pick it up really cheap in a second hand store and it's worth it.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment: Card sleeves? magic sleeves (2 5/8" * 3 5/8") fit perfectly.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Standard Ticket to Ride game. The other offer small variants which make the game a bit better.
item.wishlistcomment: Just a little too simple. Europe and others added more to the game which the family enjoys.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: Standard Ticket to Ride game so I rate it the same. Nothing too special here. I do like the added passengers strategy but that just bumps it by .5 of a point.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: Standard Ticket to Ride game so I rate it the same. Nothing too special here.

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment: Half way through we thought we were playing it wrong. Turns out I think we were playing it right. Doesn't work well for 2 players. Not sure if having three would make it any better.

item.name: Tobago
item.comment: Great family game. Start out without the treasure curses and amulets for the younger players and introduce them after a couple of games.

item.name: Tomb: Cryptmaster
item.comment: Pretty chaotic, don't get attached to your characters as you will lose them quickly. The game took a long time for every rule there is an exception on the card.

item.name: Tongiaki
item.comment: Just really didn't click for me.

item.name: Transformers Armada: Battle for Cybertron
item.comment:
Being a true transformers fan and child of the 80's, it hurts me to give this game such a low rating. A lot of luck factors into which cards you draw for your hand. Game can be very unbalanced depending on the characters that you are playing.
This is one of the first games my son bought for us to play together so I will never get rid of it.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit Silver Anniversary Coffee Table Edition
item.comment: I don't like Trivial Pursuit

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Genus II
item.comment: I don't like Trivial Pursuit. So much downtime and people are not quick enough to say "I don't know" and move on.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Master Game – Genus Edition
item.comment: I don't like Trivial Pursuit. So much downtime and people are not quick enough to say "I don't know" and move on.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Young Players Edition Master Game
item.comment: I don't like Trivial Pursuit

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Epic space game with multiple paths to victory. My gaming group has been most satisfied using "Owl's House Rules" found in the files section for balancing it out in some areas. Now victory points are always very close between players when the game is over.

item.name: Vapor's Gambit
item.comment: Just didn't get it. I have some other racing games so this one just isn't going to get to the table.

item.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo
item.comment: Good worker placement with a good map that encourages movement and expansion. Different character abilities also help change strategies.

item.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Path of the Zealot
Waterloo
item.comment: One of the first "adult" board games I played as a kid with my dad. He enjoyed it more then I did at the time :)

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Good trivia game for the family that is NOT Trivial Pursuit.

item.name: Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment: When the games are quick it's nice. Sometimes they drag on a little long.

item.name: Zombie Fluxx
item.comment: v1.0. Fluxx has certainly aged in this household. My son is old enough that we have moved onto more complex games.

item.name: Zombie in my Pocket
item.comment: A good Print and Play game. Will play if in the right mood. I find it faster to ply online usually at http://www.mywiferocksproductions.com/

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment: After a few plays seems to be a fun, light family game. Can be confrontational or not depending on the players approach.
